intro: Ceraia clavator, commonly known as the clubbed cerastium, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Primulaceae. It is characterized by its small, clustered flowers that typically bloom in shades of white or pink. The plant has opposite, ovate leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in woodland areas. Ceraia clavator is primarily cultivated for its ornamental value due to its delicate appearance.
